bibl.title: Letter from William Crawford Gorgas to Jefferson Randolph Kean, August 20, 1906

div1.p: Gorgas refers to his previous letter soliciting suggestions for the Chief of Laboratory. He offers additional names from which to choose. He mentions other departmental news, including the use of drugs and chemical compounds.

div1.head: Letter from William Crawford Gorgas to Jefferson Randolph Kean, August 20, 1906
div1.p:
ISTHMIAN CANAL ZONE
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH
----
OFFICE OF CHIEF SANITARY OFFICER
ANCON, C. Z.
August 20, 1906. WHEN REPLYING REFER TO_________
Maj. Jefferson R. Kean,
Surgeon General's Office,
Washington, D.C.
My dear Kean:-

Yours of August 9th received. My idea in speaking about the Chief of
Laboratory was to give the Surgeon General an opportunity of putting one of the Corps in
if he wished to. I have names of men recommended by Welch, Vaughn, Councilman and others,
and will have no difficulty in filling the place. Of course for 34000 I can not get a
man of established reputation, but I can get plenty of young fellows who want to make a
reputation.

Very truly yours,
Chief Sanitary Officer.

I am sorry I lose shimer. he is a good all
around man, but I fear it is out of the question to
get more than the fifty per cent increase for service
men except in position already made.

I think I wrote you that Shorts had recommended
that the Sanitary Department report direct to him
& that I be made a commission. Magoon has
recommended that I succeed him with the exception
of the functions of Minister. That is that the organ-
ization remain as it is & I be made Governor,
Commission & be placed on the execution com-
mittee. This for the present is entiremost & of course
may amount to nothing as far as I personally am
2
Aug 20, 1906 cont'd
ISTHMIAN CANAL ZONE
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH
----
OFFICE OF CHIEF SANITARY OFFICER
ANCON, C. Z.
WHEN REPLYING REFER TO___________
concerned. I feel pretty certain though that the & efect
will be bettered in the shake up.
I have no doubt that Brechemin will look after
us all right.

As we use our node carbolic principally as a deodorant
I prefer the six per cent phenne.
The veterinary tells me that the atropine & cocaine
(100 lbs of one & 201 lbs of the other) was a clinical mis-
take in the material & Supply Department.

Young Morris was up to dinner the other day,
We hear that he is very attention to one of the young
ladies at Gorgoria. He is looking well & I hear
from his chief is doing well.
